org.dspace.servicemanager.config

Class DSpaceConfigurationService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dspace.servicemanager.config.DSpaceConfigurationService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationService

    public final class DSpaceConfigurationService
extends Object
implements ConfigurationService
    The central DSpace configuration service. This is effectively immutable once the config has loaded.
    Author:
    Aaron Zeckoski (azeckoski @ gmail.com), Kevin Van de Velde (kevin at atmire dot com), Mark Diggory (mdiggory at atmire dot com)

      • getPropertyAsType

        public <T> T getPropertyAsType(String name,
                               T defaultValue,
                               boolean setDefaultIfNotFound)
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationService
        Get a configuration property (setting) from the system, or return (and possibly store) a default value if none is found.
        Specified by:
        getPropertyAsType in interface ConfigurationService
        Parameters:
        name - the property name
        defaultValue - the value to return if this name is not found
        setDefaultIfNotFound - if this is true and the config value is not found then the default value will be set in the configuration store assuming it is not null. Otherwise the default value is just returned but not set.
        Returns:
        the property value OR null if none is found

      • setProperty

        public boolean setProperty(String name,
                           Object value)
        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationService
        Set a configuration property (setting) in the system. Type is not important here since conversion happens automatically when properties are requested.
        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface ConfigurationService
        Parameters:
        name - the property name
        value - the property value (set this to null to clear out the property)
        Returns:
        true if the property is new or changed from the existing value, false if it is the same

      • loadConfiguration

        public String[] loadConfiguration(Map<String,String> properties,
                                  boolean clear)
        Load a series of properties into the configuration. Checks to see if the settings exist or are changed and only loads changes. Clears out existing ones depending on the setting.
        Parameters:
        properties - a map of key -> value strings
        clear - if true then clears the existing configuration settings first
        Returns:
        the list of changed configuration names

      • loadConfiguration

        public String[] loadConfiguration(List<DSpaceConfig> dspaceConfigs,
                                  boolean clear)
        Load up a bunch of DSpaceConfigs into the configuration. Checks to see if the settings exist or are changed and only loads changes. Clears out existing ones depending on the setting.
        Parameters:
        dspaceConfigs - a list of DSpaceConfig objects
        clear - if true then clears the existing configuration settings first
        Returns:
        the list of changed configuration names

        Returns:

      • clear

      • loadInitialConfig

        public void loadInitialConfig(String providedHome)
        Loads up the default initial configuration from the DSpace configuration files in the file home and on the classpath. Order:
        1. Create serverId from local host name if available.
        2. Create dspace.testing = false.
        3. Determine the value of dspace.dir and add to configuration.
        4. Load classpath:config/dspace_defaults.cfg.
        5. Copy system properties with names beginning "dspace." except dspace.dir, removing the "dspace." prefix from the name.
        6. Load all classpath:dspace/config-*.cfg using whatever matched "*" as module prefix.
        7. Load all ${dspace.dir}/config/modules/*.cfg using whatever matched "*" as module prefix.
        8. Load classpath:dspace.cfg.
        9. Load from the path in the system property dspace.configuration if defined, or ${dspace.dir}/config/dspace.cfg.
        10. Perform variable substitutions throughout the assembled configuration.

        The initial value of dspace.dir will be:

        1. the value of the system property dspace.dir if defined;
        2. else the value of providedHome if not null;
        3. else the servlet container's home + "/dspace/" if defined (see getCatalina());
        4. else the user's home directory if defined;
        5. else "/".
        Parameters:
        providedHome - DSpace home directory, or null.

      • replaceAndAddConfig

        protected boolean replaceAndAddConfig(DSpaceConfig dsConfig)
        Adds in this DSConfig and then updates the config by checking for replacements everywhere else.
        Parameters:
        dsConfig - a DSConfig to update the value of and then add in to the main config
        Returns:
        true if the config changed or is new

      • replaceVariables

        protected void replaceVariables(Map<String,DSpaceConfig> dsConfiguration)
        This will replace the ${key} with the value from the matching key if it exists. Logs a warning if the key does not exist. Goes through and updates the replacements for the the entire configuration and updates any replaced values.
